wikipedia_page.main:
Charles Paget (1799 – August 1873) was a British politician.
Paget came from an old Leicestershire family. He represented Nottingham as a Liberal from 1856 (on the promotion of the former MP to Lord Belper) to 1865. He lived at the grange in Ruddington, five miles from Nottingham, which he built in 1828.He had six children by his first wife, Eliza, who died in 1834.  He and his second wife were drowned by a freak wave at Filey.

response: Charles Paget, local Nottingham MP, in 1828 built the Ruddington Grange manor house, which established the hamlet of the same name.
* Charles Paget, 6th Marquess of Anglesey (1885–1947), British soldier
* Charles Paget, 8th Marquess of Anglesey (born 1950), British nobleman
* Charles Paget (politician) (1799–1873), MP for Nottingham in the 1850s
* Charles Paget (Royal Navy officer) (1778–1839), MP and vice-admiral
In 1860 he married Caroline Paget, daughter of Charles Paget, MP.

link_mentions.page: Records of members of parliament of the United Kingdom
response: * Henry Paget, Lord Paget (later 1st Marquess of Anglesey) served 1790–1804 and 1806–10; Arthur Paget 1794–1807; Berkeley Paget 1807–26; Sir Charles Paget 1804–26 and 1831–33 and 1833–34; Sir Edward Paget, 1796–1806 and 1810–20; and William Paget 1790 to his death in 1794. Four of the brothers began serving under the pre-1801 Parliament of Great Britain and their service in the Commons totalled 79 years.
